newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar to seek partners at MENA summit.
newsitem.headline: Qatar to seek partners at MENA summit.

text.p: Qatar will seek foreign partners for 15 medium-size chemical projects at the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) economic summit it plans to host in November, a Qatari official said on Saturday.

"We will offer these projects as joint ventures and seek direct foreign investment from multinational corporations which will be attending the conference," a press statement by Sheikh Abdullah bin Ahmed al-Thani, Assistant Undersecretary at the Ministry of Energy and Industry, said.

Sheikh Abdullah said the ministry's department of industrial development has signed a contract with India's Tata Economic Consultancy Services (TECS) to prepare feasibility reports for 40 projects which could use Qatar's abundant gas and petrochemical production as raw materials to produce value-added products.
TECS director, Narendra Sheth, told reporters all projects would be export oriented and would have a maximum price tag of $200 million each.
Qatar expects about 3,000 businessmen and officials from Asia, the Middle East, Europe and the U.S. to attend the MENA summit.
"Our focus will be on recommending those downstream projects which have wide applications in the plastic industry and markets in all parts of the world," said Sheikh Abdullah.
Qatar controls the world's third largest reservoir of gas, after Russia and Iran. So far, it has been working on major liquefied natural gas (LNG) and other cost-intensive petrochemical projects.
